ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
1=Phase 1: Treatment as Usual(TAU); 2=Phase 2: Screening Only; 3=Phase 3: Intervention; 4=Focus Groups; 5=Open Trial; 6=Randomized Trial; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: 1. At this point, how logical does the therapy offered to you seem?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 5 = Somewhat; 9 = Very; 999 = Prefer no to respond

ElementDescription: 2. At this point, how successfully do you think this treatment will be in reducing your symptoms?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 5 = Somewhat; 9 = Very; 999 = Prefer no to respond

ElementDescription: 3. How confident would you be in recommending this treatment to a friend who experiences similar problems?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 5 = Somewhat; 9 = Very; 999 = Prefer no to respond

ElementDescription: 4. By the end of the therapy period, how much improvement in your symptoms do you think will occur?
1. At this point, how much do you really feel that therapy will help you to reduce your symptoms?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 5 = Somewhat; 9 = Very much; 999 = Prefer no to respond

ElementDescription: 2. By the end of the therapy period, how much improvement in your symptoms do you really feel will occur?
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
